column2: Describe

The person is a friend of mine. She kept insulting my jewelry making techniques even though I kept reminding her that I'm just starting to learn how to do something. Her insistence on negging my work pissed me off because she's holding me up to her expert standards and telling me things I already know as if I'm completely ignorant and know nothing. I've forgiven her and am still friends with her, but I refuse to show her my work until it's more polished. This may seem trivial, but I'm autistic and have been bullied in various ways all of my life.

I had a close friend who often would judge my actions and say hurtful things about me. This one instance, we were getting food together and he accused me of being someone who only seeked male validation and told me that my friends were all talking behind my back. He also explained to me why my ex-boyfriend was much happier in his current relationship and talked about my mental health.

My daughter hurt my feelings. We were having a discussion and she told me in so many words that she blamed me for not realizing that she might have been neurodivergent in her childhood. I talked with her and told her I would help her to get tested as an adult now if that's what she wants. I tried not to let her know how hurt I was, and even though I was hurt, I have forgiven her. She hurt me emotionally.

My college ex boyfriend was extremely emotionally and verbally abusive. I didn't understand it at the time because he was very subtle in his control and manipulation tactics. Since college i have had many years to process our relationship and have sense forgiven him. While it took me years to fully heal, i am happy with where i am now at in life.
My sister and I have birthdays that are just a few days apart, we always wish each other happy birthday and send a card, she somehow forgot my birthday one year

I knew a person in school who was very dismissive of my passion for music. He was rude and negative telling me I'd never amount to anything. I felt repulsed by his negativity but knew he probably had his own internal battles to deal with. He wasn't really a bad person, just really negative and had controversial takes on matters. I forgave him not too shortly after and just stopped talking about music around him. This decision was liberating and I no longer felt animosity towards him.

My best friend and I were planning to call one night and I was really looking forward to it, especially because she had just transferred to a different college. She told me she would not be able to call anymore because she was also planning to spend time with her brother. I felt hurt and like I was not a priority to her, but I was also trying to understand her perspective. I prayed about the situation and forgave her, even though I was hurt.

my mother, in many ways, was very good.  that being said she could be emotionally abusive at times.  at the time of the incident i was an avid social tennis player.  she harped and harped that tennis was taking time away from my family and was inferring i was not a good mother.  in truth, i only played when the children were at school.  i was so mad at my mother because i knew once something was on her radar she would not let in drop.  it went on and on.  i did forgive my mother because the good she did far outweighed the emotional abuse she could dish out.

I walked into our kitchen where my partner was. She looked in a bad mood, so I tried to be comedic and tell a joke to get her in a better mood. She seemed to like my joke. However, when I told it, she slapped my left shoulder blade area and left a large welt.

I generally don't forgive those who have harmed me except for one person, my father. He's mostly a brute and a bully and selfish. He lived by me and would call asking if I want him to visit and bring his grandson his favorite food but then never showed up. He would then drive 2 hours to visit my sister anytime she needed him.

My then boyfriend who i was with at the time for 6 years cheated on me.  It was a really hard blow.  I loved him so much.  While he wasnt physical with the other girl he was lying to me about going to get drinks with her.  He was texting her on a seperate app,  I saw the texts, they werent sexual but if it wasnt bad then why hide it.  I was completely heartbroken.  I left our apartment and moved back in with my parents for 2 weeks.  He begged me to come back,  I told him only if i can meet this girl . He agreed, we met and although i absolutely hate her, she is a complete mess and said she liked me more then my boyfriend.  I stuck by him because i knew he would see what a mistake this all was, while my heart was shattered for years after, he was able to mend it piece by piece and we are now happily married with a 3 year old daughter.  I decided to forgive and it was the best decision i could have made.

My ex boyfriend, whom I loved very much, constantly accused me of cheating on him and refused to believe that it couldn't be further from the trust. He arranged to have sex with someone in his home and intentionally left her lingerie in the bed so that I would find it while we were intimate, and said he did that to hurt me for cheating on him, which never happened.

My mother constantly crosses my boundaries and insults me for things that I've told her are not okay to say. She upset me earlier this year (2023), when she gas-lit me and made me believe that I said something over 5 years ago, when I never said it. She has a tendency to not remember things correctly and it really upsets me. When I try to correct her, she claims that I'm remembering things incorrectly and gas lights me. It makes me feel emotionally abused.

The past isn't really the past. As long as you carry it within you, it will be a part of your present and will affect your future. You will never be able to forget the person who hurt you and you will probably never forget how much it hurt.But once you forgive someone i have allowed myself to move on. Forgiveness won't come today. It won't come tomorrow or maybe even this year. But there will be one day when i feel that it's time to let it go, leave what happened behind in the past.

around 6 years ago, my roommate brought home the woman I had feelings for and they canoodled inches away from where I slept (we shared a wall). The next day I yelled at him and made him cry. While he knowingly did something that would hurt my feelings, I felt bad making him cry, and I also dislike holding on to grudges, even if I am in the right. Grudges take too much energy, so I forgave him. He ended up getting "me too'ed" a few years later and lost his beloved theater job. I say he really got what was coming to him regardless of what happened between us.

I was going through a hard time as my dad was just getting better from surgery. My uncle then went off about something so I started to yell at him. It hurt me quite a bit and I was nervous to be around him. He came back the next day and apologized. So did I.

My previous partner and I had a large fight before calling off our wedding. In this fight he expressed feelings about my potential aptitude as a mother, my mental health, etc. in extremely unkind ways which affected my significantly emotionally. He also physically threatened me multiple times and backed me into a corner. I felt very unsafe and defensive and tried to remain calm, but obviously my actions contributed to his response in some way. I ended up forgiving him after 2 years of being apart because of the freedom it granted me, rather than whether or not it impacted our relationship or gave me closure.

i remembered when i was sacked in my previous work 10 years ago because i decided to cover up for my collegue.
he reported me for his own benefit and i was sacked, it really touched me but i had to let go of the emotional pain and i forgave him

I parked my car in the high school parking lot. I got a call to go to the principal's office. There, I was told that someone had hit my car. I went to go out to look at it and saw a huge dent. The girl came forward and apologized. While I was upset that my car was hit, and the accident was very inconvenient, I accepted the girl's apology.

Had a bad divorce that was not my fault. In the end I forgave the person and wished them nothing but the best. After being quiet for a few years we have been able to be friends and can speak to each other again.

Last Christmas my neighbor was invited to join us for snacks and drinks. She had already been drinking and maybe was insecure around my family. She proceeded to insult me several times in a "joking" manner, causing me to become defensive, and other guests to chime in. It ruined the mood and really hurt my feelings. I spoke to her about it a couple weeks later and she apologized so I forgave her.

My husband unexpectedly left me. It absolutely wrecked me emotionally. I was completely devastated. However, time passed, and the strong emotions faded. I'm doing okay now and I can understand why he left. I have forgiven him, and see that divorce was best for the both of us.

My mom hurt my feelings when she yelled at me and called me a b*tch within the past year. She has dementia and so she acts like a child and I was trying to help her with something and she got defensive and hurt my feelings. I ended up forgiving her because she can't control her behavior but I will never forget it.

I had a close friend and we were very flirtatious with each other at times. It got to the point where there was some obvious chemistry and we ended up hooking up after a night of drinks  and we both admitted feelings. Well after a few days she completely spooked out and regretted everything and said she saw me only as a friend. I was hurt by this because everyone knew it wasn't true she was just trying to distance herself from me because she's afraid of being in a relationship. I kept wondering what her actual issue was, i was blaming myself but at the end of the day after some time had passed I opened the door to being friends again because genuinely we had a great platonic friendship before we even did anything romantic.

I WAS INTERVIEWING FOR A NEW POSITION IN THE DEPARTMENT I WORK IN AND I FELT THIS WAS AN IMPORTANT STEP IN MY CAREER DEVELOPMENT.  MY SUPERVISOR INTERVIEWED PEOPLE FROM INSIDE AND OUTSIDE THE COMPANY. HE HAD HIRED ME A YEAR AGO AND I THINK HE WANTED ME TO BE THE BEST CANDIDATE FOR THE PROMOTION. HE HAD SPENT A LOT OF TIME AND ENERGY DEVELOPING MY SKILLS AND LED ME TO BELIEVE I HAD MADE PROGRESS TOWARD A PROMOTION AND INCREASE IN SALARY. I FELT MY INTERVIEW WENT GREAT AND COULD HARDLY WAIT TO FIND OUT WHO GOT THE PROMOTION.  AFTER FINISHING THE INTERVIEW PROCCESS HE PICKED ANOTHER PERSON FROM INSIDE THE COMPANY WHO I HAD COMPETED WITH FOR TOP SALES EMPLOYEE. FOR AN EXPLANATION AND HE JUST SAID I WAS NOT THE BEST CANDIDATE. I SET UP A MEETING WITH HIM AND HE EXPLAINED WHAT I NEEDED TO ACCOMPLISH TO GET THE NEXT PROMOTION AND I FELT HE WAS HONEST SO I ACCPETED HIS COMMENTS AND FORGAVE HIM FOR THE DECISION ME MAKE.

Well my brother was off living with his girlfriend and doing a lot of drugs. I was suppose to have an extensive heart surgery that would require me to stay in the hospital for a year. Beforer the surgey my parents threw me a goodbye party. My brother never came to that party and never called to ask how I was. Forgently at the last minute they cancelled my surgey because I might die and no might not work.

A time in where someone has harmed me emotionally was my brother. We were young at the time and he said some really mean things to me. I didn't forgive him for a very long time until recently when I was thinking about my life and where it was going. I just needed to sort things it out and that relationship was one of them.

i had a friend once who i didnt know well but was getting to know better. she was a bright person. at some point she told me she didnt want to be friends anymore and that hurt me. i had thought we were getting close. i ended up forgiving her because she had good reasons for not wanting to be friends with me at that moment. i just didnt realize that at the time.

My husband who was my fiance at the time, had developed a friendship with a waitress near his work. It was innocent until it wasn't and it tore me apart completely. I was angry and devestated and jealous that he had talked about kinks with her. It took me a good year to finally forgive him and be okay. I have borderline personality disorder so this had felt like betrayal to the limit. It took a lot of work on his part to open up to me, and me to practice compassion and forgiveness.

I friend betrayed me by lending money to help out a woman that has actively trashed me to other people publicly, then denied helping her to my face. When I presented this friend with written evidence that they did lend this woman money (that this chick never paid back, by the way,) they had nothing to say. I stewed over it for a couple of years, but ended up forgiving my friend. It helped that this woman went on to totally fuck my friend over. That made me happy and sort of was how I was able to forgive (but not forget.)

My best friend invited me to come and sleep over at her house. As she took a bath later that night she wrote a letter to my boyfriend that he should break up with me because I‚Äôm not right for him and that he should be with her. It also came out that she was abusing drugs at the time. I eventually forgave her and we stopped fighting. We don‚Äôt talk anymore but we are cordial.

When I was a Senior in High School, my boyfriend went to a party I was not at. At the party, I heard of things occurring physically with another girl in my grade. I was hurt, knowing if I was there the action would not have occurred, as well as had my trust in this person broken. My boyfriend was overcome with sadness and shame, apologizing endlessly. At that point, I knew this would not be my life long partner, however, selfishly, I did not want to disrupt the rest of my year with the drama, so I forgave him.

It was my ex boyfriend.  He said some things to me during an argument that were very emotionally damaging.  It hurt me very badly, and I still think about it.  He also embarrassed me very much at work and damaged my reputation. It took several months, but I ended up forgiving him and now we are good friends.

A close friend was very insulting towards me several months ago. The friendship effectively went on pause for some number of months, as I personally deemed the friendship not worth any effort. The friendship has since been mended. The relationship dynamic is still slightly different but is in a better state now than prior.

Someone I really cared about hurt me a lot. They said things that really cut me fairly deep. It was really tough to deal with all the pain and anger that I was left with from this. But as time passed, I realized that holding onto those feelings was only going to make things worse for me. So, I decided to forgive them.

My mom has been in and out of rehab several times, and each time she promises to do better, she does the very worst, she stole some money I had saved in my room and used it on drugs knowing I would forgive her and not report it.

In high school, my boyfriend cheated on me. I tried to leave his house, but I wasn't the one driving. I tried to open the car doors and he was holding my wrists down so I couldn't move. I was crying and he was saying I was crazy and lying to hide his infidelity. I took him back the next day.

My ex-boyfriend lied, cheated, manipulated and was very emotional abusive to me over the span of our 5 year relationship. After we broke up I refused to speak to him for years, although he wanted to be friends. I ended up forgiving him after a few years and today we are on good terms. I realized that we were both very young and he's done the work to be a better person and improve. I do think that he still has more work to do and I am hopeful that he will continue that journey. While I've forgiven him for his mistakes ad we are friends now, the trauma I have will never go away, and I would never be able to be with him again in the future, eventhough he's expressed the desire to be more.

A few years ago on my 23rd birthday, I found out my girlfriend (at the time) was cheating on me. I actually found out about it at my own party where a friend happened to stumble upon a keychain that he knew belonged to one of our mutual friends. I confronted my girlfriend about it, and she gaslit me into believing that I was crazy for thinking she was cheating. We stayed together for another 3 months until I caught her with our mutual friend at a restaurant when she said she was out of town visiting her parents. We broke up on the spot, and it took a long time to forgive her for that. Just last year, we spoke again and she apologized for her actions. I forgave her, but it is still difficult for me to trust other people to this day.

Several years ago I took in a gay man whose parents cut him off emotionally and financially, for being gay. He lived with me for a few years, then when he bought a house, I moved in with him. He is a hoarded and most likely a sociopath, he rented our third floor to a grifter who had Grinder dates over all the time who stole from us - T. was unrepentant, indignant, about the situation, so I had to move out to a studio of my own (I teach children from home and this became a not-safe environment). The emotional toll was staggering and the financial one, the move itself, was enormous. But I've been studying Buddhism and it has helped me to put only Good thoughts into the universe, and that forgiveness is Key. I'm really, really trying to forgive him.

My friend actually punched me one time.  We were partying and he thought I was trying to steal his gf.  I was not at all, and have no idea why he even thought that.  I allowed him to punch me and I kind of just went on with the night.

Someone would not talk to me for a few months over a situation that I had no control over. I know that I did nothing wrong and did my best to honor a request but it was out of my hands after that as it was up to someone to grant it. I was really hurt and we did end up talking eventually but not sure we ever discussed the issue again. I did try to reach out during those few months. I forgave the person regardless that I did nothing to deserve the treatment. I know they were dissapointed about not getting what they wanted but I believe that they should have been more understanding than just quit communication.

My brother has some mental health issues. When I was 17, he got mad at me over chores. He was supposed to do the dishes and had not done them; I knew my mom would be home within an hour or two so I reminded him of his task. This ended up escalating to him chasing me around the house with a butchers knife. He didn't harm me too bad but I did get cut up and had to leave the house and call the police.
My ex boyfriend was very awful to me. He would yell at me and drink too much. We got into physical altercations. This was 8 years ago. I have since forgiven him as he is mentally unwell.

There was an incident where a relative harmed me emotionally. She was very verbally abusive, trying to heap guilt on me for something I didn't do. She said awful things to me, accusing me of things I didn't do. She was manipulative and extremely hurtful. I was harmed by this, and didn't want anything to do with her ever again. But after some time, I decided to forgive her because she was family, and I couldn't avoid her forever

My ex-girlfriend cheated on me. She confessed to it right away and apologized profusely, which - after much personal anguish and deliberation - prompted me to give her another chance. We tried for a few months but it was never the same, and I realized we weren't going to work so I broke it off. But I still forgave her for what she did.

My younger sister frequently disrespects my partner. A couple of weeks ago she did it again. Originally I flew off the handle, and made the situation worse. However, a couple of days later, I apologized and forgave my sister for her behavior. Everything is good now.
My brother was really mad at me. He had me pinned against the wall. He swung to punch me but I ducked. He hit the wall hard.

A person I was dating in high school broke up with me when we went to college together.  I was not the ideal boyfriend but I still felt betrayed by my emotions. I ended up getting very bitter about it for a while, but eventually I forgave and forgot.  It really helped me grow as a person and made me into who I am today.

A friend told me that they did not care when I was expressing that I was having a difficult time in life and it very much hurt. They just scooted around the subject and when I told them that was hurtful they lashed out and told me that I was killing the vibe.

My wife backed out on a trip with me, saying she wasn't ready to leave our son at grandparents house overnight, but a week later said she was going on a trip with some friends.  I felt very disrespected.  I was very frustrated.  I eventually forgave her after she realized how much it hurt me.

When I was in my late teens and early twenties, I was in a long-term relationship. We ended up breaking up and it was somewhat of a messy ending. My former partner said a lot of hurtful things to me and overall, our romantic relationship was not a healthy one. I held a lot of resentment for a long time and it took me a while to heal from it. As we both got older, we got back in touch and were able to have a nice long talk about our relationship. He apologized for his behavior, and looking back, we were both so young and immature. We have a good friendship to this day.
I got into a fight with my brother a couple years ago. He hit me. He harmed me physically. I forgave hima after.

This person harmed me emotionally through social media. I met this person from another friend of mine at a party. I believed we were getting along and having a good time. The next day I received messages from him to stay away from his friends and himself. I was emotionally hurt by these statements and wanted to fix the issue. It was only after several weeks later when we hang out more that he believed I was a good man and apologized for his rude behavior.

I had a best friend of mine for 35 years who we were close like sisters. One day all of a sudden she no longer called me, visited me and walked out of my life. We had not had a fight nor any issues so I didn't understand why she avoided me and no longer spoke to me. Three years later I ran into her in a store and she said she wanted to talk to me about what happened. She claimed the reason she stayed out of my life is because she was able to have kids and I couldn't due to infertility issues. I was so hurt over that

I told my friend that her stealing thousands of dollars from her mother was wrong. She attacked me physically (punching me in the face and head, pushing me down and kicking me in the back). She was verbally attacking my lifestyle (stay-at-home-mom) and was saying terrible things about my children (they were worthless, I was stupid for having 'them things', they were degenerates, etc). I ended up forgiving her five years later because I found out that she had a tumor on her brain that was causing her to act the way she was.

My family member verbally and physically attacked me. He came at me for no reason other than that he was unhappy and taking out his anger on me. He treated me like I was abusive myself when I tried not to attack back at all. I chose to forgive him because I know he's a lot less perfect than me.

In July 2019, I discovered that my partner had cheated on me with a close friend. The emotional pain was overwhelming, and I initially felt a mix of anger, betrayal, and heartbreak. Confronting them was difficult, but over time, I chose to forgive both of them for the sake of my own healing.

I realized that holding onto resentment was only harming me further, and forgiveness became a way to release the heavy burden of negative emotions. It was a gradual process, and it took months of introspection and open communication with both individuals involved. Eventually, I found it within myself to let go of the hurt and move forward, focusing on personal growth and self-love. Looking back, the memory is bittersweet, but the act of forgiveness has allowed me to rebuild trust and find happiness again.

I was hanging out with a group of friends at the movies. While I was there a friend of mine made fun of me for something embarrassing. Everyone laughed at the joke and it made me feel ashamed and sad. However, I let it go and forgave them for the joke.

In my senior year of high school my father came home drunk one night. He was abusive towards my mother. I intervened accusing him of being an irresponsible partner and parent. His response to me was the harshest I have ever imagined. A parent should not speak to a child like that. Later he apologized and I told him I forgive him but I am not sure I fully do/did.

My first (and last boyfriend) was a year younger than me and we met on the cross country team. We hung out (NEVER sex), went to homecoming and talked often. We broke up after 3 weeks and he told my bestfriend not to give me his new number. 3 months later, I went to his Facebook page where I saw a "congratulations" wall post. He had just had a son and his baby mother didn't go to our school so that's why I didn't know.

This friend was one of my closest friends.  We have many friends in common.  I had found out that this friend was talking really bad about me behind my back regarding a certain situation. The friend was always so nice to me regarding this situation and would never show any negativity. When I confronted the person after finding out I realized I should just forgive them this one time. Even though my feelings were really hurt and I had lost some trust I did forgive them for talking so badly behind my back.

My boyfriend of around two years at the time was caught by me flirting with my friends on social media under a fake profile. I discovered only due to his phone number connecting him to the profile, and I was very upset because he would not admit to it even after the confrontation. I felt very hurt that not only was he harassing my friends, he was also lying to me and doing what I would consider to be cheating. I was 18 and had only known being his girlfriend since I was 16, so I ended up forgiving him -- of course, I still held resentment for months afterwards, and did not truly end up forgiving him and not feeling the hurt anymore until around a year and a half later.

My fiance who I was living with started an affair with someone at work.   I discovered this and it really negatively affected me.   She was fairly brazen about it and we ended up breaking up over it.   She wanted to get back together but I said I do forgive you but no chance

My former roommates were a couple that consistently wanted to engage in a three way relationship with me. I had no desire to commit to their wants and after months of back and forth, we had a falling out that hindered out relationship. They later outed my sexuality on their social media page to many people we both know, mutually. I haven't told anyone but these former roommates about my sexuality, so it was a gut-wrenching experience. As days and months went by we rekindled our relationship, and although we are not friends or roommates anymore, we can talk from time to time.
I had a physical fight with my roommate while we were both intoxicated. The next morning, my roommate apologized to me. Initially, I was hesitant to forgive him. In time, I was able to.

My boyfriend of 12 years blew out some disks in his back several years ago, and even though it took a couple of years, he developed a serious opioid addiction. There were many incidents where he verbally and/or emotionally hurt me as he snuck around and lied about his drug use, which by then, had escalated to street drugs. I don't even like to talk about this because it was so traumatic. He'd recently had 10 inches of his colon removed in an emergency operation and had a colostomy bag. He was wildly hallucinating one night, completely out of his mind, and was trying to pull out his intestines, and I barely stopped him from killing himself in the most gruesome way imaginable. I kicked him out the next day but continued to encourage him to get help since this situation was way beyond my abilities. He died alone from an overdose 6 weeks later, and it took a while, but I've finally forgiven him for dying and realized that he was instrumental in shaping who I am today. I'd do it over again to get where I am now.
had a friend who broke my trust. i told them something in confidence and they shared it with others. was quite upset. they had no good reason to tell anyone else.

I had gone through a really rough breakup with a girlfriend, and was having a tough time dealing with it. I had confided in a friend during this time, seeking advice and just a general shoulder to cry on. I later found out that, during this time of my going to them and complaining/seeking advice, they had actually been sleeping with them. It was heartbreaking but I learned later on, to forgive them. We were young and I can't fault them for the actions my ex took, nor for the actions my friend took.

When I was 15 I went to a sleepover with a bunch of other girls.  One of the girls in the group was basically regina from mean girls.  They were taking turns doing each others hair, and offered to do mine.  After they were done, I saw that they had put nail polish in my hair and other sticky things.  It took me a very long time to get this stuff out and to this day I still occasionally think about it.  Later that year my friend confronted that girl and told her if she messed with me again, they would have her to deal with.

Last year on fall, my wife left me to go back to her hometown for almost 4 months. I remembered I did not do anything wrong before that. My ex-wife moved out of the house out of sudden without giving me any reasonable explanation. It was the most painful event that I have ever experienced. After 4 months, she came back home, explaining to me that she missed her parents and wanted to spend time with them. Moreover, she would need to spend time to think about the relationship. I ended up forgiving her because I think she may not be ready for a marriage life at that time yet.

I was emotionally harmed by a person I thought was my best friend.  He stopped calling and texting.  We used to hang out nearly every day either with or without our wives.  When I stopped by his house to see what's up, he didn't want to speak and we haven't spoken since.  I wrote him a letter wondering if there was something I did, but I haven't received a response.

Someone that I wanted to be in a relationship with had led me to believe that they might also be in a relationship with me. I really wanted this, but in the end, they ended up choosing someone else and they weren't very nice to me about it. I was very upset for a long time. But eventually I realized that we wouldn't have been a good fit and it was probably better that we hadn't ended up together, so I forgave them for the way they handled it.

I was caring for my elderly father (99-102) in my home and one day was going through his stuff and found a check book.  I looked in the checkbook and found that he had given each of the children 1,000 and only gave me 100.  I was very hurt by this since I was the one that took him and cared for him not putting him in a home.

A few years ago, a close friend betrayed my trust by spreading hurtful rumors about me, causing emotional distress. The incident took place during a social gathering, and I felt a profound sense of betrayal and sadness. Over time, I chose to confront the person, expressing my feelings and seeking understanding. Despite the initial pain, I eventually forgave them, recognizing the complexity of human relationships and the possibility of personal growth and change. This experience taught me the value of forgiveness for my own peace of mind.
My mom said something that hurt me about my body. She called my thighs big and this hurt me. This was about four years ago and we have both grown from the experience.

A person put a gun to my head and gave me 3 seconds to live. He started counting down from 3 and I had to run on out of there.  I forgave him in my mind cause I never saw the guy again. But it took me years to get over the anger and just forgive him.

I was in a car accident with a good friend. They were driving and I was a passenger. They were driving someone erratically like a jackass, and we wound up in a minor car accident. This flared up a back injury and resulted in having one leg paralyzed for a few months. I eventually healed up and got the use of my leg back, and my friend apologized and was forgiven.
I was in a relationship a few years ago at the end of which, I was dumped.  He was really not nice about it but had no reason to act that way.  After the fact I wound up forgiving him.

My first girlfriend in college ended our relationship and it took quite the emotional toll on me. It was during my freshman year and I moved across the country for school. We met at a campus organization meeting and quickly got along. We started hanging out a lot until I grew the courage to ask her out. We began dating in November 2018. Things were going well, but Winter Break came along and we both went home for the holidays. Upon return, I noticed that she wasn't answering my texts nor was she responding to any of our friends'. She ghosted me, thus effectively ending our relationship without any real closure. I even walked past her on campus, but she looked at me as if she didn't know me. It took me awhile to get over her as she was my first girlfriend. However, time heals most wounds and I found the courage to forgive her despite never speaking to her again.

My neighbor had been tormenting me for three years. He harassed me and harassed my daughter. I eventually took him to court but the judge wanted us to work the problems out ourselves. He called and sort of apologized and provided a way for us to work things through. I was willing to forgive him.

The light had indeed come on very early and the bike continued for much longer than the usual 20 miles, but I researched and saw that was a common problem with this particular bike. He never accepted my explanation and, although I knew what happened with our misunderstanding, it still hurt immensely that he thought I had lied to him. He refused to discuss it further.

I had a girlfriend, who I was going to ask to marry me on Christmas, break up with me on Christmas eve. She had no idea I was going to pop the question. I was hurt like nothing before and it took me a while to get over it. Eventually I forgave her, we got back together, but later realized it was just not working.

Was just having a normal conversation with a friend that kept goin on about certain things. It eventually got to a point where they basically ignored everything about what I was doing or dealing with and because I was not on par with them, went as far as degrading my situation. They went in telling me that I need to get off my ass and do something with my life, all because I was not actively working a physical job like they were and was looking for something better. Felt like they absolutely did not care for what I want and that I need to just follow through like everyone else instead of looking for something that I actually want to do and pursue.

I had a major fight with my sister when she asked my honest opinion of the man she was dating. My sister did not like my answer and began screaming at me telling me she would never want to be like me and pointing out all the mistakes I had made in my life. I was so hurt by some of the nasty things she said to me. As time went on she finally apologized and told me she didn't mean what she said and was just upset about how awful the relationship she was in was.
one time I had a big fight with my brother he harmed me physically and emotionally, but he asked for forgiveness and I forgave him. everything was ok after that but I still remember it

i did an investment with a friend of mine and when it was time to get my returns she kept coming up with flimsy excuses and i later found out my friend channeled the money towards some personal problems and i got so angry but ended up forgiving her even though i would never trust her anymore.
Well about 2 years ago my wife and i had an arguement and she left he for about 3 days i was really shocked
My boyfriend cheated on me. I found out after his friend told me . I questioned my boyfriend and he admitted it. I was sad and this felt like being stabbed in the back.

Someone was making me feel really sad and humiliated. They always acted like we were in a competition even though they were someone I really trusted. They made me feel like I did not deserve to be in a happy relationship with someone I really loved and cared about.

Someone I was in a relationship with became abusive, and each time there was an episode, they apologized afterward and said they had not quite been themselves when it happened, and they were going to try to do better. After a few weeks the same thing happened, and it was just a repeat. They begged for forgiveness and pointed out how many problems they had from having grown up in an abusive household.

I found messages in my husband's phone to and from another person about a planned encounter. I was completely caught off guard and I was devastated. I was hurt, scared, and honestly just lost at the thought of what I was supposed to do with that information. At the time, we had two young tweens and being a single parent just wasn't....couldn't happen. He agreed to go to counseling and after a very long time I did allow myself to forgive him for his indiscretions. That doesn't mean that I have forgotten or that I allow myself to be vulnerable anymore, but to an extent, forgiveness has happened.

My long term girlfriend dumped me after so many years of dating and it was very devastating to accept,but a point I had to understand her perspective and agree with the decision cos she was rather in love with someone else

A person I considered a close friend tried taking advantage of me. I could not believe someone I felt this close to would do this. I would have happily helped them if they had just asked and were authentic about it. I forgave them but I do not consider them a close friend anymore.

When I was in the 10th grade and some dude started called me the b word for nothing. I wasnt really offended by the statement because it wasn't true at all. I was offended by me not doing nothing for a response like this.

My girlfriend of a few years was still with her husband but had told me she was no longer together.  We were out one day at Home Depot and ran into her husband which turned into a very awkward event.  I was worried that he might attack me so I just acted like she was my friend although we had been holding hands which would be really weird.  They left together and I left separately but there was more drama to follow.

While attending a high school graduation ceremony, I was with a group of friends. After the ceremony, we walked as a group to the exit of the building. On the way there, my friends stopped quite a bit to greet and say hi to friends. It was crowded so I ended up getting lost eventually. They left without me. I was hurt emotionally, but they apologized and I quickly accepted.
column3: I don't really remember the year. I think it was 2018 or 2019.

column2: There was a person I was dating back when I was around 21 years old. I had become very fond of her and we were together quite a while. Eventually, my friend Mike talked with her too. I found out later on that she had cheated on me with him. I was crushed at this. I didn't even want to talk to her or him. Eventually, after time had passed, I did forgive her. In that i let go of the anger and sadness I had towards her. I even talked to her a bit.

My wife wanted a divorce because she said I was a problem in her life. We ended up divorcing. Later I found out that during the last year we were married she was having an affair. This really upset me emotionally. We had been married and faithful to each other for thirty six years. I have forgave her and now we are still good friends that get along very well!

When I was 20, I was emotionally harmed by a girl I knew. I had feelings for her and she had feelings for me. We decided to try it out. It worked for awhile but in the end, she ended up breaking up with me. It seemed to be going so well, no fights, nothing bad. But I guess she wasn't feeling it. I was emotionally destroyed. At the end of the day though, I did ended up forgiving her. It was hard, but I did.

I was in a relationship with Shannon the mother of my kids for 14 years. I have been diagnosed with depression. During the summer of 2018 I was having a hard time with my problem and checked myself into a psychiatric hospital. When the doctor called Shannon about me coming home, she told the doctor I wasn't welcome back home. At the time My kids were 13, 11, and 11(I have twins).

Roughly 5 years ago, I met someone who I believed was likely going to be the person I'd spend the rest of my life with. She was perfect in every way to me and I was under the impression that we shared an unbreakable connection. Probably a year or so after we began dating, I found out that she had still been talking to an ex-girlfriend of hers. I was completely shattered by this and we broke things off almost instantaneously. It took me a year or two to finally recover from that emotional blow, and I even inevitably ended up forgiving her for that. It wasn't easy at first, but I found the strength inside to finally forgive her and move on with my life.

One sunny afternoon at the park, my brother and I decided to enjoy a bike ride together. As we were pedaling through the winding paths, an unexpected turn led to a collision between our bikes. Suddenly, my brother crashed into me, causing me to be knocked off my bike and onto the soft grass. It happened so quickly, and my arm took the brunt of the impact, resulting in a painful injury. Despite the initial shock, my brother rushed to my side, expressing concern and regret for the accident.

My husband wrongly thought I had cheated on him. He ended up snapping and repeatedly hitting me with a stick. I separated from him for about a year. Meanwhile, he ended up being charged by the state for domestic violence. He was in jail for several months. He was released on probation. As part of probation he had to undergo counseling for anger management. We started talking again. I have forgiven him and have given him a second chance. So far our relationship is better than it was before.

The event was a verbal interaction with a family member in which they said insulting and derogatory things about me not to me face but within my hearing range.  This person was very close to me and I had helped them a lot financially and emotionally and was very hurt by their comments.  We had a verbal blow up and didn't speak to each other for a couple of years.  We reconciled and I forgave them and understood that we were both under stress.

I had a good buddy at work.  I considered him a good friend and we even hung out outside of work.  A promotion came up at the job and we were basically the best candidates for it.  He betrayed and deceived me in order to get it.

I had a great friend about 17 years ago where we had a physical fight over something stupid I was drinking that day and said some mean things but that still doesnt mean that my friend wasnt in the wrong either it was like it needed to happen because after that we got more close.I apologized for my behavior and we are still friends to this day.

There was a woman who I was casually dating when I was a college student (we were intimate).

I say "casually dating", although I took the relationship rather seriously, and was faithful to her. 

At one point, the relationship got serious enough to the point where I thought we were no longer casually dating, as did people around us.

One night, after we had been out drinking together with mutual friends, we went back to her apartment, and she invited another man into her room right in front of me.

In retrospect, this horrifies me, but at the time it was sort of normal for the lifestyle that she was leading, and I was very naive.

It's hard to explain why, but I forgave her for this (to myself, not explicitly to her), and I don't feel bitter or resentful.

i had a friend that was in a bad mood and snapped at me for no reason.  i am sensitve i get hurt easy.  i cried from the pain.  i did not speak to the lady friend for a while.  god told me to forgive her.  it was hard but felt a little better afterwards.  i never forget, i may forgive.
there was this time my partner cheated on me. this was very emotional for me but i ended up forgiving him

About 8 years ago, I had a coworker we will call Alex. Alex constantly undermined my work, dismissed my ideas, and even took credit for some of my accomplishments. They would make snide comments and belittle me in front of other colleagues, which left me feeling humiliated and hurt. The emotional harm caused by Alex's actions affected my confidence and overall well-being at work.

My oldest son had an argument with me over things that happened to him as a child which I had little control over. I understand children often blame parents for things that occurred in the past. I was very sick for a period when he was younger, and I know he harbors resentment, but I do know he has sympathy for me as well.I do forgive him as he always feels guilty after an outburst.
Some time ago I was hurt by my partner, he was unfaithful to me with another person and it hurt me a lot, but then over time I managed to forgive her and heal wounds.
I was betrayed by a person closest to me. This individual went to say lies about me to a person i see as a benefactor.

This is regarding my ex-boyfriend who had lied to me for the first time. We had graduated college together and were long distance. We both shared a mutual friend who at the time was much closer to me. They went off to a concert together and I couldn't go due to being physically far away. My ex-boyfriend assured me it'd be a normal event but he wouldn't drink due to having an important job interview the next day. I find out accidentally from the mutual friend that he did drink and also missed the job interview due to this. I was extremely upset and hurt by this but eventually decided to forgive him despite being lied to.

A few years ago, I was going out of town for several days to visit a friend, and I needed someone to dogsit and housesit for me. One of my good friends from work decided to drive down and stay at my house with another mutual friend to watch the house and take care of my dog for me. In return, they'd be able to explore my hometown and I would her for the job. During one of the mornings, my friend called me and I could tell by her tone of voice that she was sad and on the verge of crying. She explained to me that she and her friend invited two guys over to the house that they had met at a bar the previous night and she slept with him in my bed. I felt emotionally violated and betrayed and was furious that my dog could have also been harmed.
well i remember when gin took away my bike without my consent, i was hurt because i had to arrive at a meeting earlier that day and that made me felt very bad and emotionally down.

At work, there was someone who threw a box of sharp instruments down the recycling shoot while I was cleaning it out in a frustrating manner. I luckily had gloves on so it wasn't that bad, but one of the sharp instruments were exposed enough to pierce through my glove and I started to bleed a little. But right before I could treat it, a box of home depot tiles came down right after it, causing a little more pain to my hand before I could move out of the way. I walked over to the responder center so I can clean my hand and patch it up a little. I put some gloves over it so the person in question didn't know about it, so it didn't seem like it was on purpose.

My friend I confided in betrayed me. I told him my secrets and hoped he kept them secret too. He told my enemies about what we discussed for them to use against me. I felt betrayed to hear my secrets from my enemies when I had only discussed them with my best friend. He apologized to me when I confronted him. I forgave him but I learned my lesson.

well i was at home with my mom she was always so judgmental. i was eating a sandwich or atleast trying too. she was not content with me she started talking about her goals for me and she wouldnt stop talking and let me be a kid. and i told her too shut up and she grabbed her belt and i tried too block it and she ended up smacking me in the face with the belt by accident. and she never used another belt again but it was so upsetting for me.
column3: i have really no clue im sorry

column2: Just about 10 years ago, my husband cheated on me. I had already suspected that he had formed an emotional attachment to someone and I thought he was planning to cheat physically. I was trying to find evidence via credit card bills, search history, phone records, etc, when I found that he was looking up hotels. That's when it hit me how real it was and I was in a stupor. When he came home from work, he found me on the couch and he knew something was wrong by my expression. I asked him about the hotel. "Are you planning to meet her at a hotel?" He responded that he already had. I was devastated.

When I was about 17 years old some of my good friends and I was playing basketball. One of my friends got mad because I was winning and he started to insult me and call me names. After a while into the situation, I said something he didn't like and he actually swung at me but he missed. Even though I was mentally hurt because I thought he was my friend, I ended up forgiving him for his actions.

About six years ago, during a challenging period in my life, a close friend betrayed my trust by spreading rumors about me. The emotional harm was significant, and it took a toll on my mental well-being. Over time, I realized that holding onto resentment was only prolonging my pain. After a series of honest conversations, I discovered that my friend was struggling with personal issues and lashed out in a misguided attempt to cope. Choosing empathy over anger, I forgave them, understanding that we all have our struggles. This act of forgiveness allowed me to move forward and rebuild trust in our friendship.

My job at a correctional facility had been misplaced due to the facility closing. From driving 5 minutes away to work at another facility to driving 60 minutes away. When I began working there, the female that was working in the area had to train me on the way‚Äôs that the job was performed there. She was very rude to me and completely left me out of any conversations that was had with fellow employees which really affected me so badly that I would cry half the way to work. My nervousness had made me sick to my stomach until I arrived at work. I had to pull myself together so no one would notice how I was feeling. After a couple of months of being mistreated, I finally held my ground and I let her know my feelings and let her know how inappropriate she was. She then apologized for her actions and I forgave her for it.

I was dating my ex girlfriend and she cheated on me. This occurred while I was at work working overnight and she messaged me and I saw it during my break. She had sent me a message saying she cheated on me. It was a bit difficult to deal with at first but within a few hours after getting home from work and talking about it with her I eventually forgave her for it and tried to move past it. It didn't exactly work out because she kept doing more but this initial one I forgave.

I got into a feud with my best friend during finals week in college. We were in the same class and working on a final project together. I made a comment that my friend misinterpreted as a shot against his abilities, and he really laid into me verbally. He didn't hold back, bringing up several grievances he had against me and attacking many of my soft spots. To make matters worse, this happened in a semi -public place with others around. We didn't speak for a few days, but eventually talked about it and pretty much made amends.

There was a time about 5 years ago where I was living in a house with 3 friends. There was a season where I liked someone romantically and was trying to pursue a relationship with this person. It didn't work out. But in the process, I found out that behind the scenes, one of my friends that I lived with also liked this person, but he never disclosed his feelings for her to me either. And I remember telling him about liking this person (while he liked her too).

Later, I find out that they started dating, and I felt emotionally hurt from that. More than the fact that she liked him in comparison to me, but rather that my friend would go behind my back. I felt like our friendship should've came first and that it would have not been a big deal at the end of day that they liked each other.

But over time, I was able to forgive him because it wasn't worth having a grudge and that being a Christian, it was better to forgive than to have grudge.

I was harmed by a former manager who threatened to terminate everyone. Though this would have been illegal and she was a totally incompetent in her role, it caused emotional harm to a lot of us. However, I don't believe in holding grudges, so I forgave her.
a girl i loved and wanted to marry rejected my proposal and went off to marry another man

My ex husband is an alcoholic, and whenever he got too drunk he‚Äôd provoke people around him. There were countless times, he put me down and spoke to me abusively. Not only he mentally tormented me, he also physically abused me once. I was angry at the fact that he‚Äôs not willing to get help for the longest time. I even went to a deep depression myself because I couldn‚Äôt change anything. I ended up forgiving him as I know he had carried a lot of hurt himself.

My girlfriend cheated on me with another guy. I grew up with my girlfriend. We grew up together and practically did everything together. We started dating when we realized we love each other, only for her to go behind me and sleep with another guy she claim its just a friend.

this was when my current organization decided to overlook me for a position i was very well deserving because the managers found out that i was a gay. this  really hurt me emotionally and also affected how i use to work physically.

I fought with my sister and she said some very insulting things. It caused me to lose trust. I questioned if she really even cared about me. It was very frustrating and hurtful. We eventually talked about it and I did forgive her.
A while ago a family member said a lot of bad things about me and that led us to hate each other. After a while he apologized and I was able to forgive him.
A while ago a relative fought with me over a dog that was killed. They told him it was me when it wasn't true and we went to blows.

I was best friends with a girl since I was 4 or 5 because our parents dated for around 10 years. When they broke up we stayed friends and were inseparable, I was even her daughters god mom. However one night she was drunk and hit me in front of a bunch of people trying to act cool. I ended up forgiving her even though I was really hurt by her actions since shes like a sister.
A co-worker a few months ago spoke badly about me to my boss, that made me feel bad because I trusted him and I liked him as a person.
A few months ago a family member was cheating on finances, that made me feel very bad so much that we stopped talking completely.

I had a friend yell and curse at me in front of my child about nine months ago. I was so upset and hurt because it made other friends take sides and just made my relationships with others worse. I ended up thinking about what happened over time and wanted to make amends with my friends and we did and I think that helped us become even better friends.

I had someone who I thought was my friend who I wanted to hang out with because I had moved from another city to a new one, and wanted to spend time with others. I thought this person was my friend because they would say stuff like "oh you're my best friend!" and "You're the only person I can talk to you about this kind of stuff!" but then I started noticing over time whenever I would ask her to hang out she'd always have an excuse. At first I thought she was really having issues with her car or just genuinely could not make it, but after years of excuses, her finally making a plans twice then flaking out on me last minute or apologizing to me days later, I realized this person was not my friend but just wanted to use me to vent about their problems and then never talk to me again unless they needed something. I decided to give this person another chance, despite really thinking they were a crappy friend, but I "demoted" them to an acquaintance and someone I would rarely talk to, never invite to anything, and just decline any invitations she gives me.
Someone told very harmful lies about me that ostracized me to my son's entire family

I was in my senior year of college and I was very in love with my partner of the time. They were supposed to come visit me at school but they called me a couple days before their visit and broke up with me over the phone. I was devastated. They gave no specific reason for the break up and told me they still loved me, but couldn't do it. I was in my bedroom when they called, sitting on my bed. I never saw them again.
My father started a fight with me on my birthday.  He began yelling at me and told me some mean things.  It was in front of my husband which was embarrassing.  It was at a party at my house.

My mother decided one day to find a new place to live. She didn't tell me, and the only hint I got was her leaving a paper detailing her new address on the table. It was a cowardly move, especially she previously tried to evict me from an apartment I was co-leasing with her. She never tried to get along and she never tried to fix our relationship. She always hated me and I to this day still don't know why. I will never forgave her for what she has put me through, following that incident.

I am the only biracial person in an all white family. I have a half brother who has always been a problem. Over the past years, the half brother had seemed to grow prejudice even racist towards black people. In high school, I would have to hear his racist bantering all the time while everyone else was gone. He was violent and a full blown narcissist with not much to lose. He could've done anything to me fueled by hatred. I know he has a disdain for me. I will never forgive him for becoming such a cruel person and giving up on life it seems.

In college, the ex girlfriend of my boyfriend stalked me on our college campus.  She also stalked my social media which resulted in me having to shut down the Facebook I had at the time.  This was a situation that scared me and affected the relationship with my then boyfriend and my friends.  Even my parents reached out to the school because they were so concerned about this person coming after me and even vandalizing my car.

Unfortunately, this person assaulted me on school property because I told her that I was sick of her following me around.  It resulted in me nearly being expelled from that college because administration thought that it was a "cat fight".  This drove home what the definition of "victim blaming" is, as I was being accused of being just as responsible for the incident as someone who had been essentially stalking me for a period of time and eventually put their hands on me.

In the end, I was not expelled and neither was that person, although the entire experience taught me a valuable lesson about how malicious people can be.  Even more was how broken disciplinary systems are and how that harms victims from coming forward when they experienced injustices.

I was casually dating a guy I went to college with. We had gone on numerous sushi dates, and were moving at a moderate pace. We went back to my apartment after one date to watch a movie. He was seemingly fed up with moving too slowly sexually, and raped me. He gaslit me after until the point where I questioned if it even happened, or if I did enough to stop it.

I worked for my husbands family business. My father in law ran the store but my sister in law was his right hand person.  I worked primarily at the store front and was the point of contact for everyone that visited the store.  My sister in law somehow convinced my father in law that it made sense for him to put the business in her name for inheritance purposes and taxes and when that happened she forced me out of the company and I no  longer had a job

My best friend at the time cut me off completely from all communication. He blocked my phone number, he blocked me on social media, he even blocked me on Skype. He never gave me a reason for it. After a few years, he reached back out to me, and I asked him why he'd cut off communication. He told me he couldn't remember.

I was sitting in my girlfriend at the time's bedroom, and we were talking. She told me she had to take a phone call, which was fine, so she took it. She then started laughing as she was talking on the phone, and when I asked what was so funny, she waved me off. The call lasted ten or so minutes, and when she came back, she told me she'd been talking to the guy she was cheating on me with. It felt like I'd been punched in the stomach.

A few years ago, I was in a relationship with S. We had only been together for a couple of months, but I really liked him and had for a long time. M was a friend of mine, and I always thought I could trust her. However, she was jealous that I was with S and she was not. At a party, while S was drunk and I was not around, M made a move on him and kissed him. She then posted online about the kiss, and ended up convincing S to break up with me.

Just a few months ago, I was having an emotional breakdown and my husband replied with, "I cannot be here right now, I will see you when I see you.". My husband took the keys and left my parent's house and went back home. I was expecting him to be there for me like I am for him when he needs someone. That hurt me emotionally and I never forgave him for it and do not really confide in him or go to him when I am in need. A sense of trust was damaged that day.

In high school there was a girl who I was best friends with. She then became really mean and wanted to be friends with the popular girls. She no longer wanted to be my friend. She stopped hanging out with me and talking to me.

The person who harmed me was one of my friends in school. They did not have my back or felt embarrassed to talk to me in front of a group of people I cannot stand fake friends or people that want to pretend to be someone they are not. I will never forgive a person who cannot show their true colors initially and at least if you are blunt, I can accept that because at least you know what you want.

My husband has cheated on me multiple times. He cheated on me when we were dating, when we were engaged, and then in our marriage as well. I have forgiven him and probably never will. He lied about it and then tried to blame me for it.

My son was visiting for the holidays.  We were gathered at our house, and it included friends and family.  One person started talking about politics with my son.  They were making very insulting comments, and said anyone who supported them, the insults were the same for them too (neither were Trump supporters).  My son felt attacked, and defended himself, the other person escalated it, said very inappropriate comments to both me and my son, and left stating that they could not believe how I raised someone like that.

I was working at a bar and a coworker, who I thought was a friend, turned on me because I was friends with another worker and they had a falling out. The friend who hurt me, was jealous of the other friend and she started treating me very badly, making rude comments, not speaking to me, I did not want to come to work because she made it so miserable. She was also somewhat violent and I worried she might do me physical harm.  She eventually was fired but I never forgave her for her actions.

My husband physically harmed me one night after he was out drinking with a friend. He came home very late and told me he was at a strip club and that he had spent our christmas money. I was very upset and hurt, so I began yelling at him and he pushed me against the wall and put his hands around my throat. He then threw me to the ground and put me in a head-lock. I thought I was going to die but lucky for me, he let me go. He yelled horrible things at me and said that he could have killed me if he really wanted to. I am still married to him, and I love him, but I will NEVER forgive him for those actions.

In this event, I came out as bisexual to my parents via a note. My mom didn't respond well at all. For six weeks after that, she would talk to me constantly about it, tell me things about my past and hers that indicated that there was no way I could be queer, and said some very, very hurtful things that affected me for a long time. By the end of six weeks, I'd told her that I wasn't queer anymore and she was really relieved. We haven't really talked about it sense and it's destroyed my relationship with and view of her.

My cousin who I drove around nearly everyday because she didn't have a car and was pregnant. I didn't ask for gas money or anything I just was her transportation everyday and in the end I spent thousands on her, I'd get her food too. We became like "best friends" (her words) but I found out from multiple sources she was making fun of me behind my back (i'm on the spectrum). It all came to a head when I caught her stealing from my debit card and then we unleashed on each other and she told me all I was good for was driving and then she made fun of my car. We ended up in a physical fist fight. Even though we're civil now I haven't forgiven her for the way she smugly put me down when she was mad at me (not even the hitting part, I'm mad over her words) . I gave that girl my all.

I was living in another city at the time.  I was leaving a pub after a fun night out.  As I was walking home I was physically attacked by someone on the street. I fended the intruder off, thankfully. I was traumatized by the event.

My child's father harmed me. He was threatening and we were fighting. He ended up punching me in the face and gave me a black eye. I never was in a relationship with him again and I never forgave him.

IN JULY 2019 A FAMILY MEMBER SENT ME A TEXT EARLY IN THE MORNING BEING REALLY DISRESPECTFUL TO ME AND IT WAS OUT THE BLUE BECUASE WE SAW EACH OTHER A FEW DAYS PRIOR. HE WAS LIKE A BROTHER TO ME AND HE KNEW WHAT I WAS PERSONALLY GOING THROUGH AND HE WANTED TO BE A COMEDIAN. WE NO LONGER TALK AND I AM 100% OKAY WITH THIS.

My friend encouraged me to tag along as she stole merchandise from a store in the mall. She then accused me of doing the same thing with her once she was caught. I was incredibly frustrated that I got in trouble with the law for something I did not do. I was made out to be a bad person.

My sister wanted me to watch her house while she went out of town. Because it was my birthday, I told her no that I needed to stay home with my family. She then told me she would not be doing anything for my birthday and cut contact with me.
My boss used to be mean to me. I don't think I have forgived them for yelling at me so much and being so demanding. The were not sympathetic. They showed me no love. They only thought for themselves

I suppose a really good example would be my own mother unfortunately, although me and my brother are adopted so that might provide some comfort. She isn't our real mom. She was always hitting us and things like that, but one morning in February she let me have it. I had just walked in from outside and could tell she was in a bad mood, abuse works that way, you learn to tell when they're upset and stay out of the way. He took the money, gave me a hug and then got back into the backseat and the driver left the property. Two days later a Sheriff's detective appeared on my property to question me about a body that had been found about a mile away from my property. It was then I was told that the driver and my handyman had murdered someone and the body was in the vehicle when they arrived on my property the night my handy-man picked up the money. He not only disrespected everything he knew about me, but it triggered my PTSD for over a year until he was finally sentenced to prison and I then knew he couldn't hurt me.
